resource.chars: The Wife of Bathe Prologue \ Experience, though noon auctoritee \ Were in this world, were right ynogh to me \ To speke of wo that is in mariage; \ For, lordynges, sith I twelf yeer was of age, \ Thonked be God, that is eterne on lyve, \ Housbondes at chirche-dore I have had fyve- \ For I so ofte have ywedded bee- \ And alle were worthy men in hir degree. \ But me was toold, certeyn, nat longe agoon is, \ That sith that Crist ne wente nevere but onis \ To weddyng in the Cane of Galilee, \ That by the same ensample, taughte he me,
